intro: Marsdenia tirunelvelica, commonly known as the Nilgiri Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
